Posts.Content: For years and years I've gone to the Revlon Walk in L.A., always for and with my friend. She died three years ago and we all did it, again, for her. This year I walked for her. And for me. I was still in radiation, but I had my red survivor hat and I got my rose. I cried and cried, but it was okay. It's who I am now, a woman with cancer waiting for my dance with NED. It will be a rich wonderful experience. Go for it!!! xo, Victoria

Posts.Title: Going To My First RELAY FOR LIFE --- My UPDATE On How It Went! :)))))

Posts.Content: Dear Pink Sisters,  November 1st, it's that time of year, our annual ornament exchange. I hope people will come out and play—that means you, you, and, oh yes, you:)  If you'd like to participate, please PM me with your real name and address (or you can remain anonymous if you wish, but I'll need the address) and I'll send you a name and address in return. It's great fun as people begin receiving their ornaments and posting about them.  This is a tradition that our beloved Chenheart began and since it was her lovely idea, I'll let her words explain it: Hey Kindred Spirits~ it's that time of year again! Last year, as many of you know, I organized ( not well organized, but yeah...) an ornament exchange here on the BC boards. If any of you is interested in participating, please PM me with your real name and address~ when the list grows, I will pair you up with another warrior from the boards. We have almost no rules, so let me address what was asked of me last year, to hopefully make it easier for new ones this year! If you want to remain anonymous, that is completely up to you! If you do not want the recipient to know who the ornament is from, that is just fine. Conversely, if you do want them to know, include your name and screenname! LOL These do NOT have to be expensive! That is the nice thing about ornaments, they can be purchased quite reasonably. Also~please do NOT feel that participating in this has to have a spiritual or religious connotation. We have Christians here, lapsed Christians, Jews, Muslims, Athiest, fill in the blank, and they are pretty much represented here. An ornament need not depict anything religious... last year I got an ormament from one of our Kindred Spirits in Texas, and she sent an ormament in the shape of the state! Like me, I am sure you have seen all sorts of ornaments; wine bottles, surfboards, teddy bears, candy, pink ribbons (!!!) the list is endless. Sometimes, the participant lets me know that they are part of a certain faith, in that case I let their Secret Santa know. Conversely, if someone says they do NOT celebrate the holidays per se, but want to exchange ornaments, I will let that be known as well. This was a lot of fun last year! We had a good time thinking about what to get one another, wondering what and when we would get our ornament from someone else, and it connected us in a wonderful way which touched us in ways that cancer cannot. It was a loving, fun, upbuilding way to join hearts. So, if you want to be a part of this, PM me! I need your names and addresses, which I PROMISE I will keep safe and not share with anyone else!!!!! I think that by December 1st I will have to say No More Names!!! I hope to have enough names to start pairing you up by mid-November, and you can take it from there as to when you mail it! Hugs, Chen♥

Posts.Title: Update BJmom

Posts.Content: Just in case you miss my big "oh, yay!!!" post, the results came in -- stromal fibrosis and focal microcalcifications which I haven't looked up yet because I've been busy letting people know I'm okay. The doctor is out of town, but her nurse says it's a GOOD report with recommendation to resume annual mammograms. Whew. Thank you, each and every one of you, for walking this journey with me. xoxo Victoria
Posts.Title: aisling8: Thinking of you and waiting with you

Posts.Content: It's so very nice to have all of you waiting with me.  I'm all right. Becoming a little agoraphobic -- I handle it better here at home on my own than when I go out to work, etc. So I'm sitting here on my bed, computer on my lap, cranking out work transcripts, something that needs to get done anyway. It's all irritating, this Friday, maybe Monday, finding out business. Five years ago I found out in three days so I know it's possible. But I'm sure the lab has their work load, blah blah blah. Thank you for caring. xoxo Victoria

Posts.Content: I have is of you standing at the kitchen sink with a glass of water in one hand and a pill in the other. You stare at it and wonder what the heck you're In for. Then you look out the window. Then you kind of sigh, shrug your shoulders, and take the pill. Then you get on with your day. Waiting and wondering what you're gonna feel like in a few hours. The reality is probably a clinic and paperwork and signatures and monitoring. But somewhere inside you you've had that "quiet moment" and decided to kick butt. We're here for you cheering you on. Go. Fight. Win. xoxox Victoria

Posts.Title: Chenheart

Posts.Content: Fear of the unknown, the waiting, the craziness in my head -- all worse than reality. At least, that was my own experience. I was called back for another mammogram and ultrasound on January 18th. Surgery was FINALLY on March 4th. Drove me nuts. I honestly thought I could feel cancer cells spreading, moving in all over my body. The surgeon thought I was nuts. I thought her staff took too damn long to arrange things. You know the end of the story: it all worked out. Lumpectomy, clear margins, clean nodes, low Oncotype Dx score, radiation almost over (8 to go). It was my own head and heart that caused me problems. Get well so the doctors can take care of you. You will be fine. Victoria

Posts.Title: Biopsy Results are in!

Posts.Content: Here's one for you--middle son simply had to have a snake. I finally gave in, okay, iguana is inside, but snake has to be outside. Once a week the snake must eat so we'd go to the pet store and buy baby mice that, I kid you not, came home in a box that said "Yay, I found a home! Somebody loves me!" Oh, the things we do for our kids.... xo Victoria
Posts.Title: OT Iguana Story

Posts.Content: It will be a year in March and for a while I felt nothing, but the nerves are regenerating and now I get kind of stabbing pain sometimes and the breast is always tender. I notice it mostly at night because I'm a stomach sleeper:) But........it's far from horrendous, certainly a pain I can live with, and if that and the Arimidex is the extent of my problems, I will be a happy woman. xoxo Victoria
